ygData.subject: RE: Missed notes on songs. HERE HERE!
ygData.msgSnippet: I totally agree. There is NO secret nerfing going on. Do you question when you hit for max damage in melee 5 times in a row? Then why the big fuss over some
ygData.messageBody:
I totally agree. There is NO secret nerfing going on. Do you question when
you hit for max damage in melee 5 times in a row? Then why the big fuss over
some missed notes? It happens, I think they have a name for it, bad luck?
It reminds me of the cleric's list not too long ago. After a patch that
nerfed their highest DD spell 10%, there was a lengthy thread about how
Verant was TESTING them! Yes, Verant was going to see how much they could
take away before the clerics would say something :)
So expect a cleric petition on EQVault in a few days, should we expect a
bard petition shortly after?

Leaflay

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Keith G. Spencer [SMTP:kgs@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, August 10, 1999 1:39 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Missed notes on songs.
>
> From: "Keith G. Spencer" <kgs@...>
>
> Ok overall I'm pretty sure this whole silent nerfing thing is some of you
> getting worked up into a paranoid frenzy. I checked with my enchanter
> friend and he thinks he might have fizzled all of 2 times last night, but
> noted that after every patch the enchanter boards fill up with this same
> paranoid nonsense that resist rates and fizzle rates have changed, and
> after
> running a few tests they're always around where they should be.
>
> I'm going to run some trials tonight, and I suggest before anyone else
> makes
> accusations of silent nerfing or any other wonderful conspiracies they do
> the same.
>
> And a note about the random number generator, it does -seem- it likes long
> strings of failures in a row, but over time, it still comes up statiscally
> correct.
> -----Original Message-----
> From: scott brisko <scott@...>
> To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Date: Tuesday, August 10, 1999 1:20 PM
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Missed notes on songs.
>
>
> >From: scott@... (scott brisko)
> >
> >Just to add one more glitch to the list...
> >
> >I don't have the problem of missing notes that often, but when I do, it
> >seems that I miss a lot of them. The other night it took me 6-7 attempts
> to
> >get Selo's going, which seems like an awful lot of bad random numbers
> rolls
> >to get at one time. Luckily this was a non-combat situtation and it just
> >made the rest of my group ridicule me, but hey when you strum a drumstick
> >you get used to that sort of thing.
> >
> >
> >Bernwyn
